intro: Anthonotha macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved anthonotha, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features basal leaves that are large, broad, and often lobed, with a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Its flowering stems are hairy and can grow up to 30 centimeters in height. Anthonotha macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
